definitions.definition: To act as a medical doctor to.
examples: Her children doctored her back to health.

definitions.definition: To act as a medical doctor .
To make (someone) into an (academic) doctor ; to confer a doctorate upon.
To physically alter ( medically or surgically ) a living being in order to change growth or behavior .
examples: They doctored their apple trees by vigorous pruning, and now the dwarfed trees are easier to pick.
We may legally doctor a pet to reduce its libido.

definitions.definition: To genetically alter an extant species .
examples: Mendel's discoveries showed how the evolution of a species may be doctored .

definitions.definition: To alter or make obscure , as with the intention to deceive , especially a document .
examples: To doctor the signature of an instrument with intent to defraud is an example of forgery .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To act as a medical doctor to.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , humorous ) To act as a medical doctor .
( transitive ) To make (someone) into an (academic) doctor ; to confer a doctorate upon.
( transitive ) To physically alter ( medically or surgically ) a living being in order to change growth or behavior .
( transitive ) To genetically alter an extant species .
( transitive ) To alter or make obscure , as with the intention to deceive , especially a document .
( transitive ) To adulterate , drug , or poison (drink).
